Song.title: What A Friend We Have In Jesus
Song.copyright: Words & Music by Charles Converse and Joseph Scriven Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [F]What a friend we have in [Bb]Jesus, [F]all our sins and griefs to [C]bear! [F]What a privilege to [Bb]carry{,} [F]every[C]thing to God in [F]prayer. [C]O what peace we often [F]forfeit, [Bb]O what [F]needless pain we [C]bear, [F]All because we do not [Bb]carry{,} [F]ev'ry[C7]thing to God in [F]prayer.
Verse 2: [F]Have we trials and temp[Bb]tations? [F]Is there trouble any[C]where? [F]We should never be dis[Bb]couraged, [F]take it [C]to the Lord in [F]prayer. [C]Can we find a friend so [F]faithful{,} [Bb]who will [F]all our sorrows [C]share? [F]Jesus knows our every [Bb]weakness, [F]take it [C7]to the Lord in [F]prayer.
Verse 3: [F]Are we weak and heavy [Bb]laden, [F]cumbered with a load of [C]care? [F]Precious Savior still our [Bb]refuge, [F]take it [C]to the Lord in [F]prayer. [C]Do thy friends despise, for[F]sake thee? [Bb]Take it [F]to the Lord in [C]prayer. [F]In His arms He'll take and [Bb]shield thee, [F]thou wilt [C7]find a solace [F]there.
